column4: i backed up some of my files that i had on Os X before i installed ubuntu on my powerbook but i cant seem to get ubuntu to read my backups
any ideas
emm what format are the backups in?
thats the thing i cant even view the files on the disk
what extention have they got?
i know what you mean ompaul but what im saying is i dont even get that far
i cant access the cd
that reads like ooch
did you check them before you installed the happiest operating system of them all?
oh ok
yes i accessed them through Osx and they worked
okay so (A) reinstall os/x and create tarballs / gz archives - and ignore any local "i can back up your data for you" type offers
im not blowing away an entire system
O_o
okay so (B) find someone with os/x and get them out onto a drive and off like I suggest
ok that sounds like a better idea
well both are reasonable but will cost some amount of time
or i could get a Mac emulator
there is that
aha
but tbh will it do the same file format?
now you have learnt the badness of closed formats grasshopper :)
